comments.body: just a random thought, should we leave the 'background' part too? Wonder if we would ever add more features to Container like border etc where just 'color' could refer to foreground colors.

That might be clearer.  I sort of regret using the `backgroundColor` name in `BoxDecoration`.  We did that to match CSS `background-color`, but it's confusing to have a `backgroundColor` for your `foregroundDecoration`...
I meant keep the Container.backgroundColor name. Since this will always refer to the background color of the Container.

In other APIs, "background" is the assumed position and "foreground" is called out explicitly.  For example, in CustomPaint, the `painter` is for the background and the `foregroundPainter` is for the foreground.  That's because operating on the background is 10x more common than operating on the foreground.
Oki. If there's a convention already, SG
